channel.title: Comments on: Let ’em Talk
channel.description: iteration, making, building, and coding in education

item.title: By: Clara Maxcy (Cleargrace)
item.dc:creator: Clara Maxcy (Cleargrace)
item.description: I love the way you have stated your classroom practice; the way you have managed to remove yourself from the "sage on the stage". I have found that children enjoy challenging work instead of boring lecture, and your experience with what children are doing as you intro a topic is exactly what I have experienced. For me, one of the hardest parts of getting started was/is deciding what problem to put out there for the discussion. The second difficulty was/is creating the student led group environment. For the former, I choose a complex example of what I need them to be able to solve on their own. For the latter, I ask "why" and "how do you know" to get them started. A few weeks into school, they start telling me how they know without my prompt- and I hear them doing this to each other in their groups--
